item.title: Accordions
item.description: Accordions Accordions can be a useful tool in dividing and segmenting information, if used judiciously. The design system features three variants, the transcript variant is used to provide accessible content for videos and images, the navigation option (featured on the right) allows for collapsible navigation. Default Each accordion item is controlled by the user, they decide when each item opens and closes. item.title: Blockquotes
item.description: Blockquotes The Dewey design system is built using the Bootstrap 5 framework. As such, the system employs the following default bootstrap breakpoints.

item.title: Buttons
item.description: Buttons Two different varieties of button are available in the design system. Default state The button state hews closely to Bootstrap's btn-outline-secondary style. When multiple buttons are used on a page, almost all of them should in this style. Default button Default button <button class="btn btn-outline-secondary">Button label</button> or simply <button>Button label</button> Primary button This style should be used sparingly, ideally only one occurrence on each page. It should action something important, like submitting a form.

item.title: Images
item.description: Images Dewey offers various options in displaying images including borders, alignment, sizing and adding captions and transcript accordions. Markup For images used in page content, wrap all <img> tags in a <figure> tag. Remember to include an alt tag. <figure> <img src=”my-image.jpg” alt=”An example image” / > </figure> Spacing By default, each image has a margin of space-large applied top and bottom Border Add a border to your image using the class border.
